snippet: Death row inmates in North Carolina will no longer be able to cite patterns of racial bias in seeking to have their sentences set aside.
abstract: North Carolina legislature repeals law that allowed death-row inmates to challenge their sentences based on racial bias claims, paving way for executions to resume in state that has 152 people on death row.
lead_paragraph: Death row inmates in North Carolina will no longer be able to cite patterns of racial bias in seeking to have their sentences set aside.
